comments.body: nit: order the ctor first in the class
So this is the only command which respects dartSdkPath?  Odd that format above doesn't for example.

There are other commands that use the dart SDK (e.g. format calls the dartfmt binary directly), but this seems to be the only one that uses internals of the Dart SDK, hence the slightly different call.

This works, but unless we're relying on being able to override the sdk location via an env variable or other features, we could just change sdkDir to:

```
String get sdkDir => clu_util.getSdkPath();
```

I don't know if anyone is using those features - for now I'd just like to get the analyzer running cleanly again.

Can you or @pq remove the getSdkDir() call if it's no longer necessary?

The deprecated call is taken care of w/ https://github.com/flutter/flutter/commit/bde8a5f5a68c763af52780a4c033f37b9fa99620, but the question remains whether we should get rid of `options.dartSdkPath`.  Looking at `analyze_once.dart` it does appear we support a 'dart-sdk' flag so removing it would be a breaking change...
